title: Davis Reptile and Amphibian Sightings
name: Davis Reptile and Amphibian Sightings
description: Collected by undergraduate students of UC Davis

properties.name: WEAR
properties.description: West End of ARboretum, that separate little slough or pond where turtles supposedly breed. Park at Putah Creek Lodge, which is on Putah Creek Lodge Road, which is off La Rue Rd right next to Tercero. You will have to walk out to the small pond and stand on the non-trespassing side of the fence.

properties.name: ZFP1
properties.description: Zoology Fieldhouse Pond 1. Also called the Animal Communication Fieldhouse. After doing ZFP2, come back out through the fieldhouse, making sure you’ve locked the doors. Jillian’s keys will get you through the big gates that run between the two main buildings, then walk west through the storage buildings to the pond.

properties.name: ZFP2
properties.description: Zoology Fieldhouse Pond 2. Also called the Animal Communication Fieldhouse. Head out Hutchison, cross 113 and go straight through the round-about. Turn left at Campbell Road, turn right at Garrod Drive, when the road seems to turn left, stay straight on a small paved road. Park on the north side of the Animal Communications Fieldhouse. Jillian’s keys will get you in the front door of the fieldhouse and out the back door, make your way through the field to the pond.

properties.name: ZFP3
properties.description: Zoology Fieldhouse Pond 3. Also called the Animal Communication Fieldhouse. this pond is just east of the buildings, and on your right when you drive into the parking area. You can stand anywhere along the fence and take the survey.

properties.name: CEFS
properties.description: Civil Engineering Field Station. Surveying is currently cancelled at this site, no frogs were heard during winter quarter 2012.

properties.name: AWRF
properties.description: Aquatic Weed Research Facility. Continue down Brooks road until you reach a sharp corner. At this corner are the two ponds. You can take the survey from the road just around the corner from which point you can clearly see both ponds.

properties.name: RAFC
properties.description: Russel and Arthur Flood Control slumps. From campus, head west down Russel and turn right on Arthur after crossing 113. Immediately turn left into the parking lot for the Lutheran Church and park. Walk back to the intersection of Arthur and Russel and cross Russel to the bike trail on the other side. There is a gate in the fence with a sizeable hole you can climb through or if you have the dog park key you could try using that. Follow the fence on your left until you see the big shallow depressions on your right. You can take the survey at one of these.

properties.name: SGLK
properties.description: StoneGate LaKe (private). Surveying is currently cancelled at this site, no frogs were heard during winter quarter 2012.

properties.name: WEPD 1
properties.description: WEst PonD point 1. West pond point one is at the streetlight numbered C2535 on the east side of the ponds at the end nearest Arlington Blvd.

properties.name: WEPD 2
properties.description: WEst PonD point 2. This second west pond point is just north of the street sign for Shenandoah Place, anywhere right there that you can get close to the fence is fine.

properties.name: WEPD 3
properties.description: WEst PonD point 3. The 3rd point is also on the east side of the ponds, but at the north end of the walking trail. It’s easy to find because it is the observation deck north of the street sign for Isle Royale Ln.

properties.name: CCSH
properties.description: Covell Channel at Sutter Hospital. Park in the lot in front of Sutter Hospital, which is off Covell, in the area in front of the Emergency entrance. Walk almost due south through the bushes at the edge of the lot and take a survey along the ditch between the lot and Covell.

properties.name: CC113
properties.description: Covell Channel at 113 behind starbucks. Drive to the Starbucks off John Jones Rd, park, walk about two feet out of the parking lot and take the survey at the edge of the ditch.

properties.name: NDFP
properties.description: North Davis Farm Pond. (private). No permission to access at this time.

properties.name: CCND
properties.description: Covell Channel in North Davis. Heading east on Covell, take a left onto Anderson. Then turn left on Valencia, right on Condor and Left on Eagle. Park, walk along the path at the end of the court and into a park. Turn right and walk down the hill to the channel. Survey at a spot with a lot of reeds.

properties.name: NSPD
properties.description: NorthStar PonD. See directions for North Area Pond. From the observation deck at North Area pond, take a survey of Northstar from it’s north end.

properties.name: NAPD
properties.description: North Area PonD. Back on Anderson, heading Northish, a nice parking lot for this pond and Northstar Pond will be on your right almost at the point where Anderson T’s into F street. You can park there and survey at the northern observation deck for North  Area pond.

properties.name: NCCF
properties.description: North Covell Channel off F street. Follow Anderson to F street and turn left. As you reach the end of the houses, you’ll see a big pull out spot on the opposite side of the road, park there. You’ll be right above the channel. On the north side of the channel is a muddy road, walk along that road to the end of the green fence on your right and take the survey.

properties.name: WHWF 2
properties.description: WildHorse Water Feature 2. This is the first one you'll hit, even though it's numbered 2. Head north on Pole Line. Pass moore, and then you’ll see a gravel farm road with a gate on your right just past the end of the golf course. Park along the road here, or off to the side of that driveway. Walk south along Pole Line until you hit the greenbelt’s gravel road. Go through the gate, then hang a gentle right onto the golf course so you’re heading approximately SE. This pond should be right in front of you.

properties.name: WHWF 1
properties.description: WildHorse Water Feature 1. This pond is SE of WHWF2 about 15 yards.

properties.name: GBSL
properties.description: GreenBelt SLump north of Wildhorse. Surveying at this point is currently cancelled, no frogs were heard in this location during winter quarter 2012.

properties.name: WHWF3
properties.description: WildHorse Water Feature 3. After finishing GBSL, walk back to the car. Drive south on Pole Line, back towards Davis, and turn left on Moore Blvd. Then turn left on Rockwell Drive. Turn left into the parking lot for the Wildhorse Golf Course. Walk south out of the parking lot, away from the buildings, cross Rockwell and this pond will be right in front of you.

properties.name: CAWH
properties.description: Channel A through WildHorse. From WHWF3, cross Rockwell back to the parking lot. Walk to the NE (right) end of the parking lot and onto the cement golf cart path. This path heads east-north-east along the back fences of several houses. You’ll pass two paths branching to the left, then turn left on the third one. This path leads to a bridge which crosses Channel A. Take the survey from this bridge.

properties.name: LKAL
properties.description: LaKe ALhambra (private). No permission to access at this time.

properties.name: AADI
properties.description: Arroyo Avenue DItch. From Alhambra drive, turn down Caricia drive. Turn left on Arroyo Avenue  and right at the intersection with Valerosa, you’ll see a walking trail leading between two houses. The ditch is right through there, and you can survey while standing on the trail.

properties.name: EMWF 1
properties.description: El Macero Water Feature 1. Walk south from water feature 3 to find this pond.

properties.name: EMWF 2
properties.description: El Macero Water Features 2. Access granted by Cal Richardson, the golf course superintendent. Enter the course on El Macero Drive, take an immediate right on Country Club Drive and park next to EMWF2.

properties.name: EMWF 4
properties.description: El Macero Water Feature 4. After surveying 1, 2, and 3, continue driving along Country Club Drive. If you hit N. El Macero Drive, you've gone too far. Water feature 4 is just west of the last bit of Country Club Drive.

properties.name: EMWF 5
properties.description: El Macero Water Feature 5. Head east across Country Club Drive after surveying water feature 4 and follow the fairway as it heads east and then south and you'll end up at water feature 5.

properties.name: 2SDP
properties.description: 2nd Street Dog Park. The park is next to Sudwerks, survey at the big pond to your right when you walk in the gate. Sometimes the gate is locked, open it with the key from John McNearney

properties.name: ONFP
properties.description: Old North Fork of Putah Creek. From highway 80 east take the Richards Blvd exit. Continue on Richards as it turns into Cowell and then turn right on Lillard Drive. Turn right on Danbury Street. Danbury turns into Drummond Lane. Continue down Drummond until you come to a gravel turn around area wiht a telephone pole and clump of bushes in the center. park along the side of this area out of the way. The site is due west of this parking area, down the bank from the walking trail.

properties.name: WCPD
properties.description: WhitCombe PonD. This is a private pond in back of a house owned by the Whitcombe family. To access the pond, walk down the same levee road/path you used to get to NCCF, and at the end of the green fence on your right, turn right and and follow the fence line north until you can see the pond on your right. Stop and take the survey here from outside the fence.

properties.name: EMWF3
properties.description: El Macero Water Feature 3. Walk north from water feature 1, or south from water feature 2.
